summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) coordinating interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004. The emails discuss scheduling in-person and video conference interviews, travel arrangements, and mention that the attorneys provided photographs from 2004 seized from Epstein's home for identification.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)); the individual whom the attorney's clients allege assaulted them.

events.title: Alleged Assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of a law firm believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Scheduled In-Person Interview
events.description: A scheduled meeting at the U.S. Attorney's Office in New York with one alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]) and her attorney.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Interview
events.description: A scheduled video conference interview (via Skype) with another alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]) who is located in NM.

locations: Okinawa (mentioned in context of time zone)
keyFacts: Two individuals, represented by a law firm, allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.
The attorneys provided the U.S. Attorney's Office with photographs of their clients from 2004 and pictures seized from Epstein's home for identification purposes.
Interviews were scheduled for August 26-27, 2019: one in-person in New York and one via video conference for a client in NM.
The correspondence shows coordination between victim attorneys and prosecutors (SDNY) regarding victim services and interview logistics.
The document is part of case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), indicating it relates to the 2019 federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.
